revised_title: Anatomical Analysis of Sub-Fossil Malagasy Lemuroids Brains
tldr: The author examines the brains of two sub-fossil Malagasy lemurs, Globilemur Flacourti and Megaladapis madagascariensis, and compares their brain structures to those of living lemurs and other primates. The study reveals significant differences in brain size, shape, and convolutions, suggesting that these extinct lemurs had distinct neurological features and may have undergone'retrogressive evolution.'
